alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 8:19PM EST until January 02 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Pine Brook, Singac...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Sunday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 18.2 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 03/24/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.4 Sun 7 pm 19.0 18.6 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
